title: 2023 TV premiere dates : A guide to when shows are returning
body_text:
Need weekend plans?
The best things to do around the city, delivered to your inbox.
By Kevin Slane
11 minutes to read
This fall, the entire television landscape has been impacted by the dual WGA and SAG-AFTRA strikes. Even with the WGA contract now settled, the calendar of 2023 TV premiere dates is an unqualified mess, with studios trying every trick in the book to fill their schedules with programming not impacted by the work stoppages.
CBS is airing shows from other Viacom properties, including Season 1 of the hit Paramount Network series ‚ÄúYellowstone,‚Äù which premiered in 2018. The CW is importing shows from Canada, Germany, and other countries to show to American audiences for the first time. Fox is bringing back Gordon Ramsay‚Äôs ‚ÄúKitchen Nightmares‚Äù after an eight-year hiatus. Every single network is going big on game shows, reality, and other unscripted programming.
Advertisement:
Keeping track of when your favorite show is coming back is a struggle as well, with studios changing their minds about programming on a daily basis.
Last month, hosts Drew Barrymore and Bill Maher announced that their talk shows would be returning, before both changing their minds amidst criticism from union members. Since then, both shows have returned thanks to the WGA‚Äôs new contract, along with talk shows hosted by Jimmy Kimmel, Jimmy Fallon, and the rest of the regular late-night hosts.
We‚Äôve done our best to keep track of all of the 2023 TV premiere dates below, sorted into several categories. At the top of the list are shows that have scheduled premiere dates, followed by shows expected to debut in 2023 at an unknown date, and finally a list of shows that are unlikely to return in 2023.
Advertisement:
Note: Any show that we‚Äôve previously recommended in our weekly What to Watch guides will be marked with a popcorn emoji. üçø
